item.title: Victoria’s ‘loved’ pubs get financial help
item.description: Victorians might not be able to crowd pubs to watch the footy this winter but their "loved" local venues will get a funding boost to help them get through the coroanvirus crisis.

item.title: Hong Kong to give citizens reusable masks
item.description: Hong Kong's government will distribute reusable face masks to all 7.4 million citizens next week as the territory prepares to lift a first round of coronavirus-related restrictions.

item.title: Russian virus cases rise by record amount
item.description: Russia has recorded its highest daily rise in confirmed coronavirus cases with 10,633 new infections, bringing the total to 134,687, with more than half of cases and deaths in Moscow.

item.title: Iran border drownings prompt Afghan probe
item.description: Afghan officials have launched a hunt to retrieve bodies of Afghan migrants from a river in a western province after reports that Iranian border guards tortured and threw Afghans into the river to prevent their entry into Iran.

item.title: Magnitude 5.7 quake hits southern Peru
item.description: A 5.7-magnitude earthquake has struck a coastal area in southern Peru, according to the US Geological Service.

item.title: ALP’s Keneally calls for migration rethink
item.description: Labor frontbencher Kristina Keneally believes a post-coronavirus environment will provide the country an opportunity to rethink its immigration program to provide better opportunities for Australians.

item.title: Protest over Oregon’s stay-at-home order
item.description: Hundreds of people opposed to Oregon's stay-at-home order have demonstrated at the state Capitol as health officials announced dozens more cases and five additional deaths from COVID-19.

item.title: UK coronavirus death toll passes 28,000
item.description: The UK's COVID-19 death toll has risen by 621 to 28,131 as of May 1, just short of Italy.

item.title: Italy’s coronavirus death toll jumps
item.description: Deaths from the COVID-19 epidemic in Italy have jumped by 474, against 269 the day before.

item.title: Spaniards get out after 7-week lockdown
item.description: Thousands of Spaniards have woken up early on Saturday to lace up their running shoes for the first time in seven weeks after the government ended a prohibition on outdoor exercise.
